channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Crews in midair crash included a second-generation pilot and a flight attendant ‘full of life’
American man among 3 hostages set for release in next Israel-Hamas swap
item.description: Dual U.S.-Israeli national Keith Seigel is among the 3 hostages expected to be released by Hamas in the fourth swap with Israel.

item.title: Is Trump about to lead the U.S. into a trade war? Here's what to know.
item.description: Less than two weeks into his second term, President Trump may be poised to deploy steep tariffs against key U.S. trading partners.

item.title: Midair collision kills 67 people in the deadliest US air disaster in almost a quarter century
item.description: A midair collision between an Army helicopter and an American Airlines flight from Kansas has killed all 67 people aboard the two aircraft.

item.title: Who are the victims of the DC plane crash?
item.description: The victims of the mid-air collision include dedicated flight attendants and talented ice skaters.

item.title: 3 rare tiger cubs seen on camera in Thai national park for first time
item.description: The camera trap footage shows the three cubs scampering in a forest while their mother prowls around.

item.title: New Zealand's government grants a sacred mountain personhood
item.description: To New Zealand's Indigenous Māori people, the mountain Taranaki Maunga "has long been an honored ancestor."

item.title: Going to weddings and birthdays can be pricey. How to cut costs or gracefully decline
item.description: If your social calendar is burning a hole in your wallet, there are steps you can take to spend less while maintaining good relationships.

item.title: FDA OK's painkiller designed to end opioids' addiction and overdose risk
item.description: Federal officials approved a new type of pain drug designed to eliminate the risks of addiction and overdose associated with opioid​ medications like ...

item.title: German party could rely on far-right again for immigration vote
item.description: CDU leader Friedrich Merz may need support in the Bundestag from the AfD, a move that has attracted wide condemnation.

item.title: Editor's note: Reporting the midair collision will focus on facts and people's stories
item.description: NPR's reporting will continue to focus on what happened and learning what we can about the victims and telling their stories.

item.title: Father of youngest hostage among three men to be released on Saturday, Hamas says
item.description: Yarden Bibas and two others will be exchanged for more Palestinian prisoners in the fourth swap since the ceasefire began.

item.title: What to know about the NTSB and the investigation into the DC plane crash
Rwanda illegally occupying DR Congo, minister tells BBC
item.description: A Rwandan spokesperson denies the charges, saying it is trying to prevent the conflict spilling over.

item.title: What is RFK Jr.'s favorite bird? Why is this woman smiling? Find out in the quiz!
item.description: This week was hard on the conflict-averse. But if you're up on nursery rhymes, prehistoric bodily fluids and Renaissance art, you'll get at least thre...

item.title: What we know so far about Washington DC plane crash
item.description: Sixty-seven people are believed to have died in Wednesday's disaster, which is being investigated.

item.title: The latest on the fatal midair plane and helicopter crash
item.description: Video footage of the incident shows the aircraft flying at a low altitude, before an explosion happened at the moment of impact. The National Transpor...

item.title: 8 things to know about Groundhog Day and its big star, Punxsutawney Phil
item.description: The weather-predicting groundhog celebrity has met two presidents and drinks a life-extending elixir: "Our Phil is like, probably 139 years old," Grou...
